biography.bio: Hiroshi Katsuno was born on July 27, 1949 in Kumamoto, Japan as Mutsuhiro Katsuno. He is an actor, known for Haruka, nosutarujii (1993), Izo (2004) and Cataclysme force 7.9 (1980). He has been married to Kathy Nakajima since 1979. They have two children.
biography.name: Hiroshi Katsuno

biography.bio: Hikari Ishida was born on May 25, 1972 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Chizuko's Younger Sister (1991), Séance (2000) and Aitsu (1991).
biography.name: Hikari Ishida

biography.bio: Yôji Matsuda was born on October 19, 1967 in Fukuoka, Japan. He is an actor, known for Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind (1984), Princess Mononoke (1997) and La traversée du temps (2006).
biography.name: Yôji Matsuda

biography.bio: Toshinori Omi was born on December 7, 1965 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Hachi-ko (1987), I Are You, You Am Me (1982) and Le samouraï du crépuscule (2002).
biography.name: Toshinori Omi

biography.bio: Born in 1951, Haruo Yanagihara was born in Tokyo, Japan and has over 100 TV and cinema credits to his name including the 1999 version of Godzilla. Primarily, however, Bengaru remains a comedian. Speaking of which, Haruo Yanagihara chose this alias because he once saw a Bengal tiger and decided to copy the animal's posture resulting in a friend giving him that nickname.
biography.name: Bengaru

biography.bio: Toshie Negishi, who has been in dozens of supporting roles in Japanese films since 1977, was in fact revealed by the theater when she was 21 (in 'Kohei Tsuka''s hit play "Stripper Monogatari"). Faithful to the playwright she was also in several of his other plays. Her most notable appearances in films were for Shôhei Imamura ("Vengeance is Mine", 1979; "Akai no shita no nurui mizu", 2001) and Akira Kurosawa ("Dreams", 1990; "Rhapsody in August", 1991).
biography.name: Toshie Negishi

biography.bio: Ittoku Kishibe was born on January 9, 1947 in Kyoto, Japan. He is an actor and producer, known for The Blind Swordsman: Zatoichi (2003), 13 assassins (2010) and Survive Style 5+ (2004).
biography.name: Ittoku Kishibe

biography.bio: Tôru Minegishi was born on July 17, 1943 in Tokyo, Japan as Tomoo Minegishi. He was an actor, known for Departures (2008), Shinjuku Incident: Guerre de gangs à Tokyo (2009) and Godzilla vs. Biollante (1989). He was married to Tomoko Ai. He died on October 11, 2008 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Tôru Minegishi

biography.bio: Miyoko Akaza was born on February 10, 1944 in Aichi, Japan. She is an actress, known for Lady Snowblood (1973), Amours dans la neige (1968) and Haruka, nosutarujii (1993).
biography.name: Miyoko Akaza

biography.bio: Shirô Sano was born on March 4, 1955 in Shimane, Japan. He is an actor and director, known for Violent Cop (1989), Godzilla 2000 (1999) and Le soleil (2005).
biography.name: Shirô Sano

biography.bio: Yumi Takigawa was born on February 16, 1951 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for School of the Holy Beast (1974), Le cimetière de la morale (1975) and Spellbound (1999).
biography.name: Yumi Takigawa

biography.bio: Yuriko Ishida was born on October 3, 1969 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for From Up on Poppy Hill (2011), Pom Poko (1994) and Boiling Point (1990).
biography.name: Yuriko Ishida

biography.bio: Wakaba Irie was born on May 12, 1943 in Shiba, Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for I Are You, You Am Me (1982), The Little Girl Who Conquered Time (1983) and Chizuko's Younger Sister (1991).
biography.name: Wakaba Irie

biography.bio: Mitsutoshi Ishigami was an actor and writer, known for House (1977), Princess from the Moon (1987) and The Drifting Classroom (1987). He died on November 6, 2012 in Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Mitsutoshi Ishigami

biography.bio: Takuzô Kawatani was born on July 21, 1941 in China. He was an actor, known for Empire of Passion (1978), Portrait d'un criminel (1985) and The Burmese Harp (1985). He died on December 22, 1995.
biography.name: Takuzô Kawatani

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Award of the Japanese Academy
Nominated Award of the Japanese Academy

names.name: Byôin de shinu to iu koto
